oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Performance - Molly Tuttle - 2018-04-08
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Musician spotlight featuring Molly Tuttle from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on April 8, 2018. Includes questions from the audience.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Molly Tuttle;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Walk-in music / (01:25) Opening comments by Abi Tapia / (02:40) Walk-in music resumes / (03:28) Introduction of Molly Tuttle by Abi Tapia / (05:56) Opening comments by Molly / (06:22) Introduces her first song / (06:28) Performs Good Enough / (09:36) Talks about her background / (10:46) Introduces the next song / (11:20) Performs You Didn't Call My Name / (15:24) Answers question not playing fiddle / (16:18) Answers question about playing banjo / (16:33) Answers question about the Berklee School of Music in Boston / (17:23) Answers question about playing in a Mill Valley venue / (17:53) Answers question about microphone technique and using or not using a DI line / (18:33) Answers question about the style of picking she uses / (19:40) Introduces the next song and tunes to an open G tuning / (20:46) Performs Save This Heart / (23:56) Introduces the next song / () Performs Sit Back And Watch It Roll / (28:25) Answers question about her practice schedule / (29:17) Answers question about the first song that she wrote / (30:51) Answers question about her musical influences growing up / (32:25) Talks about how and when she began performing / (33:35) Answers question about teaching / (34:01) Introduces the next song / (34:30) Performs Gentle On My Mind / (37:54) Talks about her songwriting / (39:27) Answers question about writing songs with her Dad / (40:09) Answers question about courses she took at Berklee School of Music / (41:02) Answers question about the roots music scene in California growing up and the music scene in Nashville now / (42:03) Introduces the next song / (42:11) Performs Friend And A Friend / (45:20) Introduces the next song / (45:50) Performs Lightning In A Jar / (48:52) Comments about the business of music and the music industry / (51:10) Talks about her future plans / (52:16) Introduces the next song / (52:05) Performs Rain And Snow / (57:25) Answers question about taking voice lessons / (57:53) Closing comments / (58:32) Performs White Freightliner Blues / (01:01:35) Final comments / (01:04:55) FILE END
